tool.name: RaceID tSNE plots for cell types and target genes
tool.description: Produces multiple tSNE plots of cell clusters with highlighting for specific features such as genes of interest and known cell types
tool.command:
Rscript '@SCRIPT_DIR@/raceID_tsne.R' '@SCRIPT_DIR@' '$rconf_source'; mkdir '${out_html.files_path}' && cp plot_*.png '${out_html.files_path}' && echo 'RaceID tSNE

Initial k-means clusters


Final clusters


Labelled


Symbols


' > '$out_html' #if $genexp_select.use_gexpr == "Yes": #for $gene_set in $genexp_select.geneset: echo "

Expression for: [${gene_set.genes.value}]

" >> '$out_html' echo "
" >> '$out_html' ## Comma within filename... #end for #end if echo '' >> '$out_html'

configfiles.configfile: sc = readRDS( '$inp_rdat' ) output_rdat = '$out_rdat' regex_val = "" c_rseed = '$rseed' gene_sets = "" #if $genexp_select.use_gexpr == 'Yes': gene_sets = '#for $gns in $genexp_select.geneset# $gns.genes.value _split_ #end for#' regex_val = '$genexp_select.regex' #end if final_rdata = as.logical( '$final_rdata' )

param.name: inp_rdat
param.label: Input R SCset object (containing a count matrix with clusters)
param.help: This object can accept outputs from either the RaceID filter tool, or (more preferably) the RaceID diffgene tool.

param.name: use_gexpr
param.label: Highlight the expression of a set of (related) genes over all clusters?

param.name: regex
param.label: Regular expression to apply over cell labels to identify cell types
param.help: e.g. for barcodes [ cl_1_ACCAG, cl_1_ACGGA, cl_2_TTAC, ... ] can be grouped into [ cl_1, cl_2, ... ] by the expression: '_[ACTG]+', which removes the last '_' and any following characters belonging to A C T or G.

tool.help:
Generates multiple tSNE plots with custom expression highlighting for gene subsets of interest. A tSNE map can be drawn for original clusters (derived via k-means) and final clustering (derived from outliers).
Any number of genes subsets of interest can be specified to measure expression within clusters for related marker genes or genes characterising a cell type.
